content: T-rustdoc, not our concern.
please continue to triage t-rustdoc
I've said this at least 4 different times
where can I record it so that people don't keep ignoring it?
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/266220-rustdoc/topic/Notifications.20for.20issues.20to.20rustdoc.20team/near/242439273
I'm sorry. I thought our new policy, as discussed there, was that we didn't triage T-rustdoc stuff.
oh I didn't realized @apiraino had replied there
@apiraino I'm not super happy with that policy; until and unless rustdoc has regular meetings, these will continue to slip through the cracks
unless you want to change the automation to add I-nominated instead of I-prioritize for rustdoc issues? I would be ok with that
my main concern is that we don't end up with a giant trail of regressions that no one has so much as looked at

like these two, which AFAIK have never been discussed (well, the second one has been discussed by T-compiler, but not T-rustdoc): https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=label%3Aregression-from-stable-to-stable+label%3AT-rustdoc+is%3Aopen
Why would T-rustdoc see things with I-nominated but not I-prioritize?
we have automation that pings the team on I-nominated
changing the automation to work with I-prioritize seems fine too
That sounds like a sensible way to handle it to me?
sure, and we could change it not to go to wg-prioritization at the same time
ok let me do that now

@Noah Lev you implemented required_labels originally, right? is there any particular reason they're AND-d instead of OR-d? not sure how to make this work with the current setup since "T-rustdoc" is only allowed to appear once
"I-prioritize" is already taken by the ping for WG-prioritization
@simulacrum could you (or another admin) move this to #t-compiler/wg-prioritization?

Joshua Nelson said:

apiraino I'm not super happy with that policy; until and unless rustdoc has regular meetings, these will continue to slip through the cracks

@Joshua Nelson I failed to clearly express my thoughts on this. I'll try now with a bullet list, let's see if it works better :-)

  • nobody in WG-prioritization set a policy whatsoever about not prioritizing T-rustdoc issues
  • WG-prioritization does not want to ignore T-rustdoc issues if this pre-triaging task is not handled by the team itself
  • we will keep prioritizing T-rustdoc issues, if they reach us through the I-prioritize label
  • ... and if we see a potential P-high (or above) we will reach the T-rustdoc folks to be sure it's under control
This is not a policy, just some common-sense guideline. This is what I think could work best at this time, but if you have suggestions on to improve, please let us know :-)
@apiraino that sounds great :) I will try to work on automation to send this to T-rustdoc instead but that seems like a very reasonable policy in the meantime

cool! About the triagebot, some works are about to start to make some notifications more team specific (example the I-nominated label to become something like I-nominated-for-team).

Once that part is figured out, we might extend the concept to other labels too (like the I-prioritize)
Dieses Thema wurde von apiraino aus #t-compiler/wg-prioritization/alerts > Should rustdoc issues be triaged? hierher verschoben

Joshua Nelson said:

Noah Lev you implemented required_labels originally, right? is there any particular reason they're AND-d instead of OR-d? not sure how to make this work with the current setup since "T-rustdoc" is only allowed to appear once

No, I just added configuration to triagebot.toml that uses required_labels.
Looks like it was added in triagebot#616.
